tv.generator-info-name: WebGrab+Plus/w MDB & REX Postprocess -- version V2.1.7 -- Jan van Straaten

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family
programme.desc: Criminal barristers Sasha Wass and Jeremy Dein investigate the 1937 case of 23-year-old Ruby Keen, who was found strangled to death with her own scarf in an alleyway in Leighton Buzzard, Bedfordshire. Ex-boyfriend Leslie Stone was found guilty of murder and hanged. More than 80 years later, Stone's nieces cannot believe their uncle committed such a heinous crime and want to learn more about his character and the case, which was kept a secret from them by their mother.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A former bank in Crewe is sold, a flood-damaged home in Cumbria is bought to benefit the community, and in Tooting, south London, a developer has grand plans for a two-bedroom flat.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: Tempers flare when sheriffs visit a garage that sold a car that a court determined should have its price refunded after it left a mother and her children stranded on a busy road. Plus, Billy and Michael have an early morning encounter with a particularly abusive debtor.(n)

programme.title: Dom on the Spot
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood accompanies officers of West Mercia Police as they deal with a call concerning a potential firearms incident. Plus, the pizza takeaway apparently dumping its rubbish in the wrong place.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross introduces proceedings at Epsom Racecourse, where the reds and blues go head to head to make as much profit as possible. Danny Sebastian and David Harper look after the bargain hunters who have to spend £300 on three items within an hour in the hope they'll make loads of money at the auction in Maidenhead, Berkshire.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Karen has to bring Mikey to work - and Becky isn't happy. Zara faces the prospect of Mother's Day without Joe. Al is confronted by an angry woman when he parks in a disabled bay.(n)

programme.title: Pitching In
programme.desc: Inspired by Royston's old-skool Northern Soul type dancing and annoyed that a rival caravan park is stealing all their customers, Carys decides to hold a Take That tribute night at Daffodil Dunes. The only problem is the booking agent mishears her and, instead of four guys showing up in Glan Mor to drive the local women wild, a Tommy Cooper impressionist turns up instead. Danny holds a birthday party for Tanya in their pub. During the celebrations, he makes an announcement - and she is convinced he's going to propose. Drama, starring Larry Lamb and Caroline Sheen. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman heads to the south Wales countryside to help a couple with £500,000 to spend on relocating from Newport to a village community. While in the region, Nicki visits the only whisky distillery in Wales that uses the mineral-rich water of the Brecon Beacons - to potent effect.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: At the recycling centre in Woking, EJ Osborne unearths three hidden gems with profit-making potential. To transform his trash, EJ calls on robot maker Mark Haig to find a new use for an unwanted tape player, while designer maker Rupert Blanchard has the tall order of making half a chest of drawers whole again. A draughting chair is also given the upcycling treatment by EJ.(n)

programme.title: Blue Planet UK
programme.desc: A look at whether herring, the `silver darlings of the sea' are making a comeback. Plus, a man shares his passion for sea horses and Gillian Burke investigates whether being a brave crab is a disastrous strategy. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and guest host Ashley Banjo present the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances.(n)

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: Former Premier League striker Kevin Phillips, Olympic medal-winning swimmer Jazz Carlin, England Rugby forward Chris Robshaw and ex-British Athletics star Iwan Thomas join regular team captains Matt Dawson and Phil Tufnell and host Sue Barker on the quiz.(n)

programme.title: Would I Lie to You
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by space scientist Maggie Aderin-Pocock, comedian Phil Wang, actor Jason Watkins and EastEnders star Adam Woodyatt, aiming to deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Sharon demands answers from Phil and asks him to keep Keanu away from Louise. Mitch relishes in the success of his pop-up salon, where a customer, Gray, takes a liking to Chantelle and leaves her a generous tip. Later, Patrick announces which of the businesses he will be investing in. Billy takes Will and Janet for dinner only to be called away for work, so Habiba steps in and asks Adam to join them.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: After an arduous seven-week journey, the finalists have to push themselves to the limit for one last time before judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace crown the champion. The trio must produce the best three dishes of their lives, push their culinary boundaries and produce jaw-droppingly good food for the judges. It's now or never for these exceptional amateur cooks, the final chance to pull out all the stops and demonstrate the kind of cook they have become, as only one can lift the trophy and become the 15th MasterChef Champion. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Sliding Doors
programme.desc: A London woman's entire future hinges on whether or not she catches a train. In one version of events, she gets the chance to start afresh and lead a happy new life, but in the other she is stuck supporting her lazy, unfaithful boyfriend. Comedy drama, presenting two parallel stories featuring the same character. Starring Gwyneth Paltrow, John Hannah and John Lynch.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty present national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Host Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Sabrina Ghayour and Nathan Outlaw, while guest Stacey Dooley faces her food heaven or hell. Olly Smith chooses wines to accompany the dishes.(n)

programme.title: Mary Berry's Quick Cooking
programme.desc: Mary heads to the hustle and bustle of Marrakesh to explore every side of Moroccan cuisine. She rustles up some quick dishes inspired by the aromatic flavours and smells of the medina quarter, from the mounds of olives and heady spices at the markets to the slow-cooked tagines prepared in the heart of a family kitchen and the high-end delights of Moha Fedal. one of the country's greatest chefs. Mary brings the fragrant flavours home, cooking a speedy lamb tagine, a spicy carrot hummus and a fresh summer salad.(n)

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Dan Walker and guests review the week's headlines and look ahead to forthcoming fixtures, including Fulham v Manchester City and Liverpool v Tottenham Hotspur in the Premier League.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin-Sharp presents as the hunt for bargains heads to Oswestry, Shropshire, where experts Jonathan Pratt and John Cameron assist two teams of friends competing to buy three items in the hope of making the most profit at auction. Natasha also heads to Hawarden, Flintstone, to visit Gladstone's Library, Britain's only prime ministerial library, where she reveals what a wheelbarrow and a former prime minister have in common.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore prevents an old leather sofa, some shelves and seven rusty chairs from being dumped at the tip in Surrey, and sets about transforming them in the hope they can be sold.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman meets a couple who have already sold up and are desperate to invest £425,000 in their perfect home in Somerset.(n)

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of the classified results and this afternoon's news from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys puts four more celebrities in the spotlight in another episode of the classic quiz. Taking part tonight are comedian Dane Baptiste, vlogger Grace Victory, Hollyoaks actress Annie Wallace (Sally St Claire) and broadcaster and one-time MP Martin Bell. The specialist subjects are the Marvel Cinematic Universe, Beyonce, Doctor Who 1970-1980 and Sir William Howard Russell.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a musical theatre edition of the general knowledge quiz, in which four teams try to come up with the answers that nobody else could think of. Featuring Ray Quinn, Joanne Clifton, Ben Forster, Kerry Ellis, Jenna Russell, Hannah Waddingham, Duncan James and Jade Ewen.(n)

programme.title: Catchpoint
programme.desc: Paddy McGuinness hosts a family-friendly game show combining physical fun and an exciting question mechanic, as contestants have to think fast as they answer questions while trying to catch balls of various sizes dropped from the studio ceiling, with a variety of entertaining rounds and a cash prize at stake.(n)

programme.title: All Together Now
programme.desc: Rob Beckett hosts the musical talent show with a twist, as a range of singers step on-stage for a chance to win a £50,000 cash prize. The judging panel takes the form of `The 100', a large collective of music experts and performers from all over the UK. However, in this talent show, the key to success is encouraging the judges to sing along too, and the more panellists each singer manages to win over, the better their chances of proceeding to the grand final. This week's contestants include a medical student, an HR manager, a West End performer and firefighting brothers, performing tracks by Paloma Faith, Christina Aguilera, Queen, Radiohead, OutKast and Stevie Wonder.(n)

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Archie butts heads with charming paediatric locum registrar Will Noble when they meet in the car park. Will reconnects with old university friend Ethan and ingratiates himself with the staff by treating them to coffees and getting to know them. Archie is not fooled by his charm offensive and keeps a close eye on Will. Elsewhere, Jade learns she's passed her exams by the skin of her teeth, and Gem thanks Jan and Ruby for their help.(n)

programme.title: All Round to Mrs Brown's
programme.desc: Brendan O'Carroll dons Agnes's famous cardigan and curly wig once again as the chat show continues. This week's edition features pop star Olly Murs and singer and presenter Jane McDonald - fresh from her latest Channel 5 cruise. Also dropping by are actress and 2018 I'm a Celebrity runner-up Emily Atack, appearing with her mother Kate Robbins, and Spandau Ballet bassist and former EastEnders bad boy Martin Kemp, who joins Dermot and Buster for an unforgettable night at the local museum.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Fulham v Manchester City at Craven Cottage and Manchester United v Watford at Old Trafford. Scott Parker's Cottagers were looking like relegation certainties, but the former England midfielder will have still been looking for a decent performance from his players against the reigning champions. Plus, action from Brighton & Hove Albion v Southampton at the Amex Stadium, Burnley v Wolverhampton Wanderers at Turf Moor, Crystal Palace v Huddersfield Town at Selhurst Park, Leicester City v Bournemouth at the King Power Stadium and West Ham United v Everton at London Stadium.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Youngest Football Boss
programme.desc: New series. Documentary following West Ham United's women's football team and their 18-year-old managing director Jack Sullivan, son of Hammers co-chairman David Sullivan.(n)

This week's contestants include a medical student, an HR manager, a West End performer and firefighting brothers, performing tracks by Paloma Faith, Christina Aguilera, Queen, Radiohead, OutKast and Stevie Wonder.(n)

programme.title: Casualty (?)
programme.desc: Archie butts heads with charming paediatric locum registrar Will Noble when they meet in the car park. Archie is not fooled by his charm offensive and keeps a close eye on Will. Elsewhere, Jade learns she's passed her exams by the skin of her teeth, and Gem thanks Jan and Ruby for their help.(n)

programme.title: All Round to Mrs Brown's (?)
programme.desc: Brendan O'Carroll dons Agnes's famous cardigan and curly wig once again as the chat show continues. This week's edition features pop star Olly Murs and singer and presenter Jane McDonald - fresh from her latest Channel 5 cruise. Also dropping by are actress and 2018 I'm a Celebrity runner-up Emily Atack, appearing with her mother Kate Robbins, and Spandau Ballet bassist and former EastEnders bad boy Martin Kemp, who joins Dermot and Buster for an unforgettable night at the local museum.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day (?)
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Fulham v Manchester City at Craven Cottage and Manchester United v Watford at Old Trafford. Scott Parker's Cottagers were looking like relegation certainties, but the former England midfielder will have still been looking for a decent performance from his players against the reigning champions. Plus, action from Brighton & Hove Albion v Southampton at the Amex Stadium, Burnley v Wolverhampton Wanderers at Turf Moor, Crystal Palace v Huddersfield Town at Selhurst Park, Leicester City v Bournemouth at the King Power Stadium and West Ham United v Everton at London Stadium.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Youngest Football Boss (?)
programme.desc: New series. Documentary following West Ham United's women's football team and their 18-year-old managing director Jack Sullivan, son of Hammers co-chairman David Sullivan.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast (?)
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family (?)
programme.desc: Criminal barristers Sasha Wass and Jeremy Dein investigate the 1937 case of 23-year-old Ruby Keen, who was found strangled to death with her own scarf in an alleyway in Leighton Buzzard, Bedfordshire. Ex-boyfriend Leslie Stone was found guilty of murder and hanged. More than 80 years later, Stone's nieces cannot believe their uncle committed such a heinous crime and want to learn more about his character and the case, which was kept a secret from them by their mother.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer (?)
programme.desc: A former bank in Crewe is sold, a flood-damaged home in Cumbria is bought to benefit the community, and in Tooting, south London, a developer has grand plans for a two-bedroom flat.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming (?)
programme.desc: Tempers flare when sheriffs visit a garage that sold a car that a court determined should have its price refunded after it left a mother and her children stranded on a busy road. Plus, Billy and Michael have an early morning encounter with a particularly abusive debtor.(n)

programme.title: Dom on the Spot (?)
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood accompanies officers of West Mercia Police as they deal with a call concerning a potential firearms incident. Plus, the pizza takeaway apparently dumping its rubbish in the wrong place.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt (?)
programme.desc: Charlie Ross introduces proceedings at Epsom Racecourse, where the reds and blues go head to head to make as much profit as possible. Danny Sebastian and David Harper look after the bargain hunters who have to spend £300 on three items within an hour in the hope they'll make loads of money at the auction in Maidenhead, Berkshire.(n)

programme.title: BBC Wales Today; Weather (?)
programme.desc: News and weather from BBC Wales.(n)

programme.title: Doctors (?)
programme.desc: Karen has to bring Mikey to work - and Becky isn't happy. Zara faces the prospect of Mother's Day without Joe. Al is confronted by an angry woman when he parks in a disabled bay.(n)

programme.title: Pitching In (?)
programme.desc: Inspired by Royston's old-skool Northern Soul type dancing and annoyed that a rival caravan park is stealing all their customers, Carys decides to hold a Take That tribute night at Daffodil Dunes. The only problem is the booking agent mishears her and, instead of four guys showing up in Glan Mor to drive the local women wild, a Tommy Cooper impressionist turns up instead. Danny holds a birthday party for Tanya in their pub. During the celebrations, he makes an announcement - and she is convinced he's going to propose. Drama, starring Larry Lamb and Caroline Sheen. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country (?)
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman heads to the south Wales countryside to help a couple with £500,000 to spend on relocating from Newport to a village community. While in the region, Nicki visits the only whisky distillery in Wales that uses the mineral-rich water of the Brecon Beacons - to potent effect.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing (?)
programme.desc: At the recycling centre in Woking, EJ Osborne unearths three hidden gems with profit-making potential. To transform his trash, EJ calls on robot maker Mark Haig to find a new use for an unwanted tape player, while designer maker Rupert Blanchard has the tall order of making half a chest of drawers whole again. A draughting chair is also given the upcycling treatment by EJ.(n)

programme.title: Blue Planet UK (?)
programme.desc: A look at whether herring, the `silver darlings of the sea' are making a comeback. Plus, a man shares his passion for sea horses and Gillian Burke investigates whether being a brave crab is a disastrous strategy. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Pointless (?)
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show (?)
programme.desc: Alex Jones and guest host Ashley Banjo present the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances.(n)

programme.title: Weatherman Walking (?)
programme.sub-title: Weatherman Walking: The Welsh Coast: Beaumaris to Red Wharf Bay
programme.desc: Derek Brockway fires the starting cannon at the Beaumaris Regatta on Anglesey, then embarks on a 14-mile walk initially taking him into the town's heavily fortified castle before heading onto the Welsh Coast Path. Derek visits the hamlet of Penmon, before heading to the photogenic Black Nose lighthouse with views over Puffin Island. The walk turns inland for a couple of miles before arriving at a new stretch of path, which has been moved much closer to the headland with fine sea views. Derek's eventual destination is Red Wharf Bay, a wide sandy bay on the east coast of the island.(n)

programme.title: Would I Lie to You (?)
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by space scientist Maggie Aderin-Pocock, comedian Phil Wang, actor Jason Watkins and EastEnders star Adam Woodyatt, aiming to deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders (?)
programme.desc: Sharon demands answers from Phil and asks him to keep Keanu away from Louise. Mitch relishes in the success of his pop-up salon, where a customer, Gray, takes a liking to Chantelle and leaves her a generous tip. Later, Patrick announces which of the businesses he will be investing in. Billy takes Will and Janet for dinner only to be called away for work, so Habiba steps in and asks Adam to join them.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef (?)
programme.desc: After an arduous seven-week journey, the finalists have to push themselves to the limit for one last time before judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace crown the champion. The trio must produce the best three dishes of their lives, push their culinary boundaries and produce jaw-droppingly good food for the judges. It's now or never for these exceptional amateur cooks, the final chance to pull out all the stops and demonstrate the kind of cook they have become, as only one can lift the trophy and become the 15th MasterChef Champion. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Sliding Doors (?)
programme.desc: A London woman's entire future hinges on whether or not she catches a train. In one version of events, she gets the chance to start afresh and lead a happy new life, but in the other she is stuck supporting her lazy, unfaithful boyfriend. Comedy drama, presenting two parallel stories featuring the same character. Starring Gwyneth Paltrow, John Hannah and John Lynch.(n)

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family (?)
programme.desc: Jeremy Dein and Sasha Wass investigate the 1962 murder of a warehouse employee during an armed robbery, asking whether the man convicted of the crime was innocent.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing (?)
programme.desc: Jay Blades rescues a tired rocking chair, old scaffolding poles and a pair of dining chairs from the tip, enlisting Kev Paxton and Simion Hawton-Smith to help transform them.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow (?)
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents a second visit to Eltham Palace, and explores the art deco wing that was built in the 1930s. Items brought in to be valued include a pair of duelling pistols with a story to tell, two rare Fijian war clubs, and a panel of stained glass from the Houses of Parliament which was broken during the Blitz.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire (?)
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live (?)
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Politics Live (?)
programme.desc: On what should be the day Britain leaves the European Union, Jo Coburn and BBC correspondents offer an update on politics from Westminster and beyond.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads (?)
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Royal Recipes (?)
programme.desc: Michael Buerk celebrates food served to British monarchs from the time of George IV to the reign of the present Queen.(n)

programme.title: Coast (?)
programme.desc: The desire to escape the daily grind and head off on holiday is something many people crave - but why do so many still make a beeline for the beach? Nick Crane and the rest of the Coast team embark on a quest to find out. He begins by following a centuries-old tourist trail to Margate, revealing that the beach has a biological effect on people's stress levels. Miranda Krestovnikoff experiences a camping safari on Shell Island in north Wales and Ruth Goodman finds out about an explosive episode of pre-war politics that put sleepy St Leonards on the front pages.(n)

programme.title: Street Auction (?)
programme.desc: Neighbours Ilona Watson and Fay Baxter started a community cafe to help bring their divided village in Rogiet, Monmouthshire, together. Ilona's husband Andy is severely disabled after a fall and Fay looks after her elderly mother who has advanced dementia. Presenters Paul Martin and Tim Weeks ask local residents to donate unwanted items to sell at a street auction so that the two unsuspecting women can be treated to a short break away.(n)

programme.title: Ocean Giants (?)
programme.desc: The documentary explores the intelligence of marine mammals, discovering just how smart whales and dolphins really are. Scientist Denise Herzing talks about the development of a two-way communication system between dolphins and humans in the Bahamas, while in Western Australia the creatures are filmed using a range of survival skills. In Mexico, grey whales seemingly empathise with humans, while the humpbacks of Alaska pool their talents to increase hunting success. Narrated by Stephen Fry.(n)

programme.title: Going Back, Giving Back (?)
programme.desc: Aled Jones goes back to the 1960s to hear the story of an inspirational woman who was lucky enough to experience an idyllic and carefree childhood in a beautiful seaside village in Cornwall. In stark contrast to her own upbringing, she meets a family living in east London who have never been outside the capital, or even seen the sea.(n)

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is (?)
programme.sub-title: David Harper v Philip Serrell - Showdown
programme.desc: Experts Philip Serrell and David Harper near the end of their week-long battle, competing over four different locations to find the best antiques to turn a profit on. It's a tense affair as they approach the showdown auction.(n)

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games (?)
programme.desc: BBC Breakfast's Naga Munchetty, singer and actor Jordan Stephens, presenter and actor Sally Lindsay and comedian David O'Doherty go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games, vying to be crowned weekly champion.(n)

programme.title: Britain in Bloom (?)
programme.desc: Chris Bavin heads to Petworth in West Sussex to meet a group of residents entering Bloom for the first time who are hoping to get a disconnected community working together. These Bloomers want to engage the whole area, from the historic town centre to the modern housing estates on the outskirts, in an effort to bring the community spirit back to their neighbourhood.(n)

programme.title: Mastermind (?)
programme.desc: John Humphrys invites four contestants to brave the black chair to answer question on their specialised subjects. of 1970s pop, politician Neville Chamberlain, ancient Greek city Sparta and writer CS Lewis. They are then each afforded two minutes to demonstrate their prowess on general knowledge.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities (?)
programme.desc: The naturalist explores the extremes of birth in the animal kingdom, explaining why the giant panda gives birth to the smallest babies of any existing mammal. He also looks at the kiwi, asking why the bird produces a single egg that is a quarter of its body mass - one of the largest in the world - and almost too big to lay.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu (?)
programme.desc: The two remaining North East chefs must cook their four-course menus again, though it remains to be seen whether they have successfully taken on board feedback from their earlier submissions. The duo need to impress food writer Matthew Fort, restaurateur Oliver Peyton, broadcaster and cook Andi Oliver, as well as guest judge record producer Pete Waterman.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World (?)
programme.desc: Monty Don gets busy on the vegetable plot and takes the next step in planting up his new Paradise Garden. With Mothering Sunday around the corner, he also provides some timely inspiration for planting up a spring pot as a present. Frances Tophill is thrilled to have her own allotment this year, and here shares her plans for the season ahead, making a start on getting it shipshape. The programme also visits the alpine house at RHS Garden Wisley to find out from the experts how they care for some of the smallest and most colourful spring gems.(n)

programme.title: Australia: Earth's Magical Kingdom (?)
programme.desc: An exploration how native creatures have adapted to survive in the human environment. In Melbourne, tree-dwelling possums have taken to sharing trees in city parks, risking encounters with traffic and cats. In Brisbane's parks, over the past 150 years of so, eastern water dragons have become twice the size of their wild cousins and without trees to climb their limbs are getting longer and claws shorter. Beyond the cities, dingoes eek out an existence in the inhospitable environment of a desert goldmine, while climate change and deforestation is posing a threat to koalas. Narrated by Barry Humphries. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Frankie Boyle's New World Order (?)
programme.desc: New series. The comedian tries to help make sense of bewildering times as he dissects the week's news using stand-up, review, discussion and audience interaction. Featuring contributions from Sara Pascoe, Lucy Prebble and a variety of comic guests.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight (?)
programme.desc: Kirsty Wark provides the latest Brexit analysis, plus an overview of international news stories.(n)

programme.title: Louis Theroux: My Scientology Movie (?)
programme.desc: The reporter investigates the controversial religious organisation, but finds himself denied access to anyone involved. Adopting a different approach, he resorts to recruiting actors to re-enact the personal stories of former members - only to find his project is under surveillance by representatives of the church.(n)

programme.title: Panorama (?)
programme.desc: Bronagh Munro examines the shocking way some academy trusts are running schools, exposing one where the boss employed relatives and whose pupils claim they were taught how to cheat on exams. She also investigates an academy trust that pays its managers big salaries, while unpaid bills and disconnection notices pile up in the classroom.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef (?)
programme.desc: Knockout week comes to a close as the 10 remaining cooks are split into two teams of five. Their challenge is to create a three-course meal in relay, with no communication allowed. They have 20 minutes each, in which time they all have to plan, create and cook a starter featuring scallops, a main course with chicken and a dessert celebrating brown sugar. The winners will automatically become semi-finalists, while the other five have to fight it out again next week to earn their place. Presented by John Torode and Gregg Wallace.(n)

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens (?)
programme.desc: Part two of two. The horticultural enthusiast explores Japan during autumn. He begins as he did in the spring, at one of the `three great gardens of Japan' to learn how they are protected from the coming winter. Monty follows the history of the Japanese garden through the military strongholds of past leaders to the many styles, new and old, of the iconic stroll garden and finds a slice of Victorian England in the heart of Tokyo. He also learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle. He ends his journey by the Sea of Japan at a place that makes art out of its gardens.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two (?)
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: All Over the Place: Asia (?)
programme.desc: Ed Petrie and his CBBC mates discover a primate rescue centre in Vietnam, explore nomadic areas of Mongolia's capital Ulaan Baatar and pay tribute to ELO in the city of Shanghai.(n)

programme.title: Wild & Weird (?)
programme.desc: Naomi Wilkinson and Tim Warwood show more clips from the natural world, including a toad that grows its babies on its back, and a two-headed snake.(n)

programme.title: Absolute Genius with Dick & Dom (?)
programme.desc: Richard McCourt and Dominic Wood reveal the genius of astronomer Caroline Herschel, who was the first person to spot a comet in the solar system.(n)

programme.title: Top Class (?)
programme.desc: Susan Calman presents as Greenland Community Primary School from County Durham take on St Michael's Church of England Primary School from Manchester.(n)

programme.title: The Dog Ate My Homework (?)
programme.desc: Team captains Tiah and Noah compete in the children's comedy panel show hosted by Iain Stirling, featuring studio-based frolics and slapstick challenges. Featuring special guests Matthew Crosby, Lauren Layfield, Dominique Moore and Saima Chowdhury.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60 on a Mission (?)
programme.sub-title: Deadly on a Mission: Pole to Pole: Shark Island
programme.desc: Steve Backshall and the team travel to Guadalupe Island, 150 miles off the Mexican coast, where he swims alongside a great white shark - without the protection of a cage. Diving into the crystal clear sea, the presenter discovers the creatures are attracted by Guadalupe fur seals, whose underwater speed and agility is no match for the fearsome predator. The presenter returns to the boat and, with a great white shark circling the vessel, prepares to step out into the blue abyss for an encounter he will never forget.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Microworlds (?)
programme.desc: Steve Backshall explores the Namib in south-west Africa, the oldest desert in the world. With little to no rainfall, the animals that live here have to be tough and Steve examines the tactics that each employs to cope with the harsh conditions, before revealing the secret that allows life to survive at all in such an environment.(n)

programme.title: Wonders of the Universe (?)
programme.desc: Professor Brian Cox explores how the development of mankind and the history of the universe are intertwined, visiting dramatic locations around the world to illustrate the fundamental scientific principles that govern the laws of nature. He begins by investigating time, charting the evolution of the cosmos and explaining why the universe must one day come to an end.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer (?)
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell explore a one-bedroom flat high on potential in London's Streatham, a coastal bungalow in Cumbria and a semi-detached property near Derby with scope for an extension. The hosts see what each went for at auction and talk to the new owners' about their plans for their aquisitions.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends (?)
programme.desc: The chef heads to the north-eastern Greek city of Thessaloniki, which nestles on the northern shores of the Aegean Sea. The city is revered as the gourmet capital of Greece and birthplace to possibly the greatest warrior general that ever lived - Alexander. Rick explores a city of many identities, boasting a young student population apparently hungry for dishes that reflect the freshest of seafood. Back home, he prepares veal and aubergine stew after meeting the doyenne of Greek cooking, Vafa Alexiadou.(n)

programme.title: Talking Pictures (?)
programme.desc: Sylvia Syms revisits some of the great British war films that helped boost the nation's morale in the difficult years that followed the end of the Second World War. Among the silver screen gems highlighted are In Which We Serve, Reach for the Sky, Bridge on the River Kwai and The Dam Busters. The programme includes archive interviews with stars including Noel Coward, Richard Attenborough, David Lean, Alec Guinness, Kenneth More and John Mills, and Sylvia shares her memories of filming her own contribution to the genre, Ice Cold in Alex.(n)

programme.title: The Wooden Horse (?)
programme.desc: British PoWs in a German camp try to escape their captors by taking up gymnastics, and using a vaulting horse to conceal the tunnel they are digging. However, even if they manage to escape the camp, the journey to neutral territory will not be an easy one. Fact-based Second World War drama, starring Leo Genn, David Tomlinson, Anthony Steel and David Greene.(n)

programme.title: Ocean Giants (?)
programme.desc: Stephen Fry narrates this documentary exploring the vocal ranges of marine mammals. Sperm whales produce clicks to locate giant squid two miles beneath the ocean surface, and narwhals use a similar technique to find breathing holes in Arctic ice floes. Bottlenose dolphins communicate with fishermen in Brazil, humpbacks offer haunting operatic performances and boto dolphins create bat-like ultrasonic calls to help find fish in the murky Amazon River.(n)

programme.title: Pilgrimage: The Road to Santiago (?)
programme.desc: On the final stretch of the Camino de Santiago pilgrimage, Ed Byrne, JJ Chalmers and the Rev Kate Bottley take a dip in the freezing water within a beautiful wooded valley. Neil Morrissey and Heather Small's snoring means some choose to sleep outside, Debbie McGee battles blisters, while journalist Raphael Rowe discovers it is the company of others that is spurring him on. As they near the end of their journey, it remains to be seen what the experience of re-enacting the 780km pilgrimage has meant to the participants and whether they can identify any lasting change within themselves. Narrated by Lee Ingleby.(n)

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People (?)
programme.desc: James concludes his examination of the social significance of cars by exploring how aspiration and new wealth were behind the development of some of the greatest models ever made. He tries to make sense of the baffling world of company car hierarchy by holding a travelling salesman race-off and indulges his 1980s urges with the twin delights of a Lamborghini and a Porsche. He also unveils his choice of the ultimate people's car - a vehicle that can lay claim to being the greatest in history.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee (?)
programme.desc: Joe Lycett hosts the semi-final, as the four remaining sewers take on garments and techniques from around the world. Firstly, they must follow a pattern like none they've encountered before, as judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young ask them to make a pair of Indian Dhoti Pants. Next is the Transformation Challenge, as the sewers take on a garment from West Africa, the Dashiki. For their final challenge, the Made to Measure, the semi-finalists take on the fiendishly tricky high-end Japanese couture technique of origami.(n)

programme.title: Race Across the World (?)
programme.desc: The four remaining teams reach the People's Republic of China. Alex has a romantic encounter while working at a flower stall to find the next stage of the journey, Natalie fulfills a childhood dream at a ski resort, tension mounts between Josh and Felix as they trek across the mountains, and Tony and Elaine face an arduous journey by train.(n)

programme.title: Dad's Army (?)
programme.desc: Captain Mainwaring and his platoon acquire a boat, planning to use it for coastal patrols, but after setting sail they get lost in fog. When the men finally reach dry land, they believe they have crossed the Channel and landed behind enemy lines. Vintage comedy first shown in 1969, starring Arthur Lowe.(n)

programme.title: Dave Allen: God's Own Comedian (?)
programme.desc: A look at the life, work and legacy of Irish comedy writer and performer Dave Allen, who started his career in entertainment as a Butlin's Redcoat. He first found fame as a chat-show host in Australia in the 1960s, before he came to Britain and began a career that took in films, plays and documentaries alongside his award-winning comedy series. Featuring interviews with family and friends including Steven Berkoff, Stephen Frears and Maggie Smith, as well as rare archive material.(n)

programme.title: Dave Allen at Peace (?)
programme.desc: Fact-based drama filmed in the style of the Irish comedian's BBC TV series, following Dave Allen from childhood to becoming one of the UK and Ireland's comedy greats, and exploring how his life and work was shaped by the tragic loss of his father, his brother and half a finger. Starring Aidan Gillen, with Ian McElhinney, Julian Rhind-Tutt, Tommy Tiernan, Pauline McLynn, Simon Day and Conleth Hill.(n)

programme.title: Dave Allen: The Immaculate Selection (?)
programme.desc: A compilation of the finest, funniest and most irreverent routines by the Irish comedy writer and performer, known for his combination of laid-back storytelling and anger at social and political hypocrisy. The programme features a selection of BBC archive material originally recorded between 1971 and 1986.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two (?)
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family (?)
programme.desc: Jeremy Dein and Sasha Wass investigate the 1962 murder of a warehouse employee during an armed robbery, asking whether the man convicted of the crime was innocent.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing (?)
programme.desc: Jay Blades rescues a tired rocking chair, old scaffolding poles and a pair of dining chairs from the tip, enlisting Kev Paxton and Simion Hawton-Smith to help transform them.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow (?)
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents a second visit to Eltham Palace, and explores the art deco wing that was built in the 1930s. Items brought in to be valued include a pair of duelling pistols with a story to tell, two rare Fijian war clubs, and a panel of stained glass from the Houses of Parliament which was broken during the Blitz.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire (?)
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live (?)
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Politics Live (?)
programme.desc: On what should be the day Britain leaves the European Union, Jo Coburn and BBC correspondents offer an update on politics from Westminster and beyond.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads (?)
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Royal Recipes (?)
programme.desc: Michael Buerk celebrates food served to British monarchs from the time of George IV to the reign of the present Queen.(n)

programme.title: Coast (?)
programme.desc: The desire to escape the daily grind and head off on holiday is something many people crave - but why do so many still make a beeline for the beach? Nick Crane and the rest of the Coast team embark on a quest to find out. He begins by following a centuries-old tourist trail to Margate, revealing that the beach has a biological effect on people's stress levels. Miranda Krestovnikoff experiences a camping safari on Shell Island in north Wales and Ruth Goodman finds out about an explosive episode of pre-war politics that put sleepy St Leonards on the front pages.(n)

programme.title: Street Auction (?)
programme.desc: Neighbours Ilona Watson and Fay Baxter started a community cafe to help bring their divided village in Rogiet, Monmouthshire, together. Ilona's husband Andy is severely disabled after a fall and Fay looks after her elderly mother who has advanced dementia. Presenters Paul Martin and Tim Weeks ask local residents to donate unwanted items to sell at a street auction so that the two unsuspecting women can be treated to a short break away.(n)

programme.title: Ocean Giants (?)
programme.desc: The documentary explores the intelligence of marine mammals, discovering just how smart whales and dolphins really are. Scientist Denise Herzing talks about the development of a two-way communication system between dolphins and humans in the Bahamas, while in Western Australia the creatures are filmed using a range of survival skills. In Mexico, grey whales seemingly empathise with humans, while the humpbacks of Alaska pool their talents to increase hunting success. Narrated by Stephen Fry.(n)

programme.title: Going Back, Giving Back (?)
programme.desc: Aled Jones goes back to the 1960s to hear the story of an inspirational woman who was lucky enough to experience an idyllic and carefree childhood in a beautiful seaside village in Cornwall. In stark contrast to her own upbringing, she meets a family living in east London who have never been outside the capital, or even seen the sea.(n)

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is (?)
programme.sub-title: David Harper v Philip Serrell - Showdown
programme.desc: Experts Philip Serrell and David Harper near the end of their week-long battle, competing over four different locations to find the best antiques to turn a profit on. It's a tense affair as they approach the showdown auction.(n)

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games (?)
programme.desc: BBC Breakfast's Naga Munchetty, singer and actor Jordan Stephens, presenter and actor Sally Lindsay and comedian David O'Doherty go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games, vying to be crowned weekly champion.(n)

programme.title: Britain in Bloom (?)
programme.desc: Chris Bavin heads to Petworth in West Sussex to meet a group of residents entering Bloom for the first time who are hoping to get a disconnected community working together. These Bloomers want to engage the whole area, from the historic town centre to the modern housing estates on the outskirts, in an effort to bring the community spirit back to their neighbourhood.(n)

programme.title: Mastermind (?)
programme.desc: John Humphrys invites four contestants to brave the black chair to answer question on their specialised subjects. of 1970s pop, politician Neville Chamberlain, ancient Greek city Sparta and writer CS Lewis. They are then each afforded two minutes to demonstrate their prowess on general knowledge.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities (?)
programme.desc: The naturalist explores the extremes of birth in the animal kingdom, explaining why the giant panda gives birth to the smallest babies of any existing mammal. He also looks at the kiwi, asking why the bird produces a single egg that is a quarter of its body mass - one of the largest in the world - and almost too big to lay.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu (?)
programme.desc: The two remaining North East chefs must cook their four-course menus again, though it remains to be seen whether they have successfully taken on board feedback from their earlier submissions. The duo need to impress food writer Matthew Fort, restaurateur Oliver Peyton, broadcaster and cook Andi Oliver, as well as guest judge record producer Pete Waterman.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World (?)
programme.desc: Monty Don gets busy on the vegetable plot and takes the next step in planting up his new Paradise Garden. With Mothering Sunday around the corner, he also provides some timely inspiration for planting up a spring pot as a present. Frances Tophill is thrilled to have her own allotment this year, and here shares her plans for the season ahead, making a start on getting it shipshape. The programme also visits the alpine house at RHS Garden Wisley to find out from the experts how they care for some of the smallest and most colourful spring gems.(n)

programme.title: Australia: Earth's Magical Kingdom (?)
programme.desc: An exploration how native creatures have adapted to survive in the human environment. In Melbourne, tree-dwelling possums have taken to sharing trees in city parks, risking encounters with traffic and cats. In Brisbane's parks, over the past 150 years of so, eastern water dragons have become twice the size of their wild cousins and without trees to climb their limbs are getting longer and claws shorter. Beyond the cities, dingoes eek out an existence in the inhospitable environment of a desert goldmine, while climate change and deforestation is posing a threat to koalas. Narrated by Barry Humphries. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Frankie Boyle's New World Order (?)
programme.desc: New series. The comedian tries to help make sense of bewildering times as he dissects the week's news using stand-up, review, discussion and audience interaction. Featuring contributions from Sara Pascoe, Lucy Prebble and a variety of comic guests.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight (?)
programme.desc: Kirsty Wark provides the latest Brexit analysis, plus an overview of international news stories.(n)

programme.title: Louis Theroux: My Scientology Movie (?)
programme.desc: The reporter investigates the controversial religious organisation, but finds himself denied access to anyone involved. Adopting a different approach, he resorts to recruiting actors to re-enact the personal stories of former members - only to find his project is under surveillance by representatives of the church.(n)

programme.title: Panorama (?)
programme.desc: Bronagh Munro examines the shocking way some academy trusts are running schools, exposing one where the boss employed relatives and whose pupils claim they were taught how to cheat on exams. She also investigates an academy trust that pays its managers big salaries, while unpaid bills and disconnection notices pile up in the classroom.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef (?)
programme.desc: Knockout week comes to a close as the 10 remaining cooks are split into two teams of five. Their challenge is to create a three-course meal in relay, with no communication allowed. They have 20 minutes each, in which time they all have to plan, create and cook a starter featuring scallops, a main course with chicken and a dessert celebrating brown sugar. The winners will automatically become semi-finalists, while the other five have to fight it out again next week to earn their place. Presented by John Torode and Gregg Wallace.(n)

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens (?)
programme.desc: Part two of two. The horticultural enthusiast explores Japan during autumn. He begins as he did in the spring, at one of the `three great gardens of Japan' to learn how they are protected from the coming winter. Monty follows the history of the Japanese garden through the military strongholds of past leaders to the many styles, new and old, of the iconic stroll garden and finds a slice of Victorian England in the heart of Tokyo. He also learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle. He ends his journey by the Sea of Japan at a place that makes art out of its gardens.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two (?)
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: All Over the Place: Asia (?)
programme.desc: Ed Petrie and his CBBC mates discover a primate rescue centre in Vietnam, explore nomadic areas of Mongolia's capital Ulaan Baatar and pay tribute to ELO in the city of Shanghai.(n)

programme.title: Wild & Weird (?)
programme.desc: Naomi Wilkinson and Tim Warwood show more clips from the natural world, including a toad that grows its babies on its back, and a two-headed snake.(n)

programme.title: Absolute Genius with Dick & Dom (?)
programme.desc: Richard McCourt and Dominic Wood reveal the genius of astronomer Caroline Herschel, who was the first person to spot a comet in the solar system.(n)

programme.title: Top Class (?)
programme.desc: Susan Calman presents as Greenland Community Primary School from County Durham take on St Michael's Church of England Primary School from Manchester.(n)

programme.title: The Dog Ate My Homework (?)
programme.desc: Team captains Tiah and Noah compete in the children's comedy panel show hosted by Iain Stirling, featuring studio-based frolics and slapstick challenges. Featuring special guests Matthew Crosby, Lauren Layfield, Dominique Moore and Saima Chowdhury.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60 on a Mission (?)
programme.sub-title: Deadly on a Mission: Pole to Pole: Shark Island
programme.desc: Steve Backshall and the team travel to Guadalupe Island, 150 miles off the Mexican coast, where he swims alongside a great white shark - without the protection of a cage. Diving into the crystal clear sea, the presenter discovers the creatures are attracted by Guadalupe fur seals, whose underwater speed and agility is no match for the fearsome predator. The presenter returns to the boat and, with a great white shark circling the vessel, prepares to step out into the blue abyss for an encounter he will never forget.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Microworlds (?)
programme.desc: Steve Backshall explores the Namib in south-west Africa, the oldest desert in the world. With little to no rainfall, the animals that live here have to be tough and Steve examines the tactics that each employs to cope with the harsh conditions, before revealing the secret that allows life to survive at all in such an environment.(n)

programme.title: Wonders of the Universe (?)
programme.desc: Professor Brian Cox explores how the development of mankind and the history of the universe are intertwined, visiting dramatic locations around the world to illustrate the fundamental scientific principles that govern the laws of nature. He begins by investigating time, charting the evolution of the cosmos and explaining why the universe must one day come to an end.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer (?)
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell explore a one-bedroom flat high on potential in London's Streatham, a coastal bungalow in Cumbria and a semi-detached property near Derby with scope for an extension. The hosts see what each went for at auction and talk to the new owners' about their plans for their aquisitions.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends (?)
programme.desc: The chef heads to the north-eastern Greek city of Thessaloniki, which nestles on the northern shores of the Aegean Sea. The city is revered as the gourmet capital of Greece and birthplace to possibly the greatest warrior general that ever lived - Alexander. Rick explores a city of many identities, boasting a young student population apparently hungry for dishes that reflect the freshest of seafood. Back home, he prepares veal and aubergine stew after meeting the doyenne of Greek cooking, Vafa Alexiadou.(n)

programme.title: Talking Pictures (?)
programme.desc: Sylvia Syms revisits some of the great British war films that helped boost the nation's morale in the difficult years that followed the end of the Second World War. Among the silver screen gems highlighted are In Which We Serve, Reach for the Sky, Bridge on the River Kwai and The Dam Busters. The programme includes archive interviews with stars including Noel Coward, Richard Attenborough, David Lean, Alec Guinness, Kenneth More and John Mills, and Sylvia shares her memories of filming her own contribution to the genre, Ice Cold in Alex.(n)

Bottlenose dolphins communicate with fishermen in Brazil, humpbacks offer haunting operatic performances and boto dolphins create bat-like ultrasonic calls to help find fish in the murky Amazon River.(n)

programme.title: Coast (?)
programme.sub-title: The Secret Life of Sea Cliffs 2
programme.desc: The team explores some of the most spectacular and scary sea cliffs in Britain.(n)

programme.title: Friday Night Football (?)
programme.sub-title: Irish Cup Semi-Final: Coleraine v Crusaders
programme.desc: Coleraine v Crusaders (Kick-off 5.30pm). Stephen Watson presents live coverage of the concluding last-four fixture at The Oval in Belfast. Coleraine prevailed 5-3 after extra time in a thrilling tie away to Larne in the quarter-finals. Meanwhile, Crusaders enjoyed an altogether more comfortable 3-0 home win against Ballymena United at the same stage, and will go into this match as slight favourites given their superior league form this season.(n)

programme.title: Weather Watchers with Barra Best (?)
programme.desc: The weather presenter and journalist examines how climate shapes everyone's lives and looks at the activities that it enables people to participate in.(n)

programme.title: Race Across the World (?)
programme.desc: The four remaining teams reach the People's Republic of China. programme.title: The Wooden Horse (?)
programme.desc: British PoWs in a German camp try to escape their captors by taking up gymnastics, and using a vaulting horse to conceal the tunnel they are digging. However, even if they manage to escape the camp, the journey to neutral territory will not be an easy one. Fact-based Second World War drama, starring Leo Genn, David Tomlinson, Anthony Steel and David Greene.(n)

programme.title: Ocean Giants (?)
programme.desc: Stephen Fry narrates this documentary exploring the vocal ranges of marine mammals. Sperm whales produce clicks to locate giant squid two miles beneath the ocean surface, and narwhals use a similar technique to find breathing holes in Arctic ice floes. Bottlenose dolphins communicate with fishermen in Brazil, humpbacks offer haunting operatic performances and boto dolphins create bat-like ultrasonic calls to help find fish in the murky Amazon River.(n)

programme.title: Pilgrimage: The Road to Santiago (?)
programme.desc: On the final stretch of the Camino de Santiago pilgrimage, Ed Byrne, JJ Chalmers and the Rev Kate Bottley take a dip in the freezing water within a beautiful wooded valley. Neil Morrissey and Heather Small's snoring means some choose to sleep outside, Debbie McGee battles blisters, while journalist Raphael Rowe discovers it is the company of others that is spurring him on. As they near the end of their journey, it remains to be seen what the experience of re-enacting the 780km pilgrimage has meant to the participants and whether they can identify any lasting change within themselves. Narrated by Lee Ingleby.(n)

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People (?)
programme.desc: James concludes his examination of the social significance of cars by exploring how aspiration and new wealth were behind the development of some of the greatest models ever made. He tries to make sense of the baffling world of company car hierarchy by holding a travelling salesman race-off and indulges his 1980s urges with the twin delights of a Lamborghini and a Porsche. He also unveils his choice of the ultimate people's car - a vehicle that can lay claim to being the greatest in history.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee (?)
programme.desc: Joe Lycett hosts the semi-final, as the four remaining sewers take on garments and techniques from around the world. Firstly, they must follow a pattern like none they've encountered before, as judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young ask them to make a pair of Indian Dhoti Pants. Next is the Transformation Challenge, as the sewers take on a garment from West Africa, the Dashiki. For their final challenge, the Made to Measure, the semi-finalists take on the fiendishly tricky high-end Japanese couture technique of origami.(n)

programme.title: Race Across the World (?)
programme.desc: The four remaining teams reach the People's Republic of China. Alex has a romantic encounter while working at a flower stall to find the next stage of the journey, Natalie fulfills a childhood dream at a ski resort, tension mounts between Josh and Felix as they trek across the mountains, and Tony and Elaine face an arduous journey by train.(n)

programme.title: Dad's Army (?)
programme.desc: Captain Mainwaring and his platoon acquire a boat, planning to use it for coastal patrols, but after setting sail they get lost in fog. When the men finally reach dry land, they believe they have crossed the Channel and landed behind enemy lines. Vintage comedy first shown in 1969, starring Arthur Lowe.(n)

programme.title: Dave Allen: God's Own Comedian (?)
programme.desc: A look at the life, work and legacy of Irish comedy writer and performer Dave Allen, who started his career in entertainment as a Butlin's Redcoat. He first found fame as a chat-show host in Australia in the 1960s, before he came to Britain and began a career that took in films, plays and documentaries alongside his award-winning comedy series. Featuring interviews with family and friends including Steven Berkoff, Stephen Frears and Maggie Smith, as well as rare archive material.(n)

programme.title: Dave Allen at Peace (?)
programme.desc: Fact-based drama filmed in the style of the Irish comedian's BBC TV series, following Dave Allen from childhood to becoming one of the UK and Ireland's comedy greats, and exploring how his life and work was shaped by the tragic loss of his father, his brother and half a finger. Starring Aidan Gillen, with Ian McElhinney, Julian Rhind-Tutt, Tommy Tiernan, Pauline McLynn, Simon Day and Conleth Hill.(n)

programme.title: Dave Allen: The Immaculate Selection (?)
programme.desc: A compilation of the finest, funniest and most irreverent routines by the Irish comedy writer and performer, known for his combination of laid-back storytelling and anger at social and political hypocrisy. The programme features a selection of BBC archive material originally recorded between 1971 and 1986.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two (?)
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family (?)
programme.desc: Jeremy Dein and Sasha Wass investigate the 1962 murder of a warehouse employee during an armed robbery, asking whether the man convicted of the crime was innocent.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing (?)
programme.desc: Jay Blades rescues a tired rocking chair, old scaffolding poles and a pair of dining chairs from the tip, enlisting Kev Paxton and Simion Hawton-Smith to help transform them.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow (?)
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents a second visit to Eltham Palace, and explores the art deco wing that was built in the 1930s. Items brought in to be valued include a pair of duelling pistols with a story to tell, two rare Fijian war clubs, and a panel of stained glass from the Houses of Parliament which was broken during the Blitz.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire (?)
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live (?)
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Politics Live (?)
programme.desc: On what should be the day Britain leaves the European Union, Jo Coburn and BBC correspondents offer an update on politics from Westminster and beyond.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads (?)
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Royal Recipes (?)
programme.desc: Michael Buerk celebrates food served to British monarchs from the time of George IV to the reign of the present Queen.(n)

programme.title: Coast (?)
programme.desc: The desire to escape the daily grind and head off on holiday is something many people crave - but why do so many still make a beeline for the beach? Nick Crane and the rest of the Coast team embark on a quest to find out. He begins by following a centuries-old tourist trail to Margate, revealing that the beach has a biological effect on people's stress levels. Miranda Krestovnikoff experiences a camping safari on Shell Island in north Wales and Ruth Goodman finds out about an explosive episode of pre-war politics that put sleepy St Leonards on the front pages.(n)

programme.title: Street Auction (?)
programme.desc: Neighbours Ilona Watson and Fay Baxter started a community cafe to help bring their divided village in Rogiet, Monmouthshire, together. Ilona's husband Andy is severely disabled after a fall and Fay looks after her elderly mother who has advanced dementia. Presenters Paul Martin and Tim Weeks ask local residents to donate unwanted items to sell at a street auction so that the two unsuspecting women can be treated to a short break away.(n)

programme.title: Ocean Giants (?)
programme.desc: The documentary explores the intelligence of marine mammals, discovering just how smart whales and dolphins really are. Scientist Denise Herzing talks about the development of a two-way communication system between dolphins and humans in the Bahamas, while in Western Australia the creatures are filmed using a range of survival skills. In Mexico, grey whales seemingly empathise with humans, while the humpbacks of Alaska pool their talents to increase hunting success. Narrated by Stephen Fry.(n)

programme.title: Going Back, Giving Back (?)
programme.desc: Aled Jones goes back to the 1960s to hear the story of an inspirational woman who was lucky enough to experience an idyllic and carefree childhood in a beautiful seaside village in Cornwall. In stark contrast to her own upbringing, she meets a family living in east London who have never been outside the capital, or even seen the sea.(n)

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is (?)
programme.sub-title: David Harper v Philip Serrell - Showdown
programme.desc: Experts Philip Serrell and David Harper near the end of their week-long battle, competing over four different locations to find the best antiques to turn a profit on. It's a tense affair as they approach the showdown auction.(n)

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games (?)
programme.desc: BBC Breakfast's Naga Munchetty, singer and actor Jordan Stephens, presenter and actor Sally Lindsay and comedian David O'Doherty go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games, vying to be crowned weekly champion.(n)

programme.title: Britain in Bloom (?)
programme.desc: Chris Bavin heads to Petworth in West Sussex to meet a group of residents entering Bloom for the first time who are hoping to get a disconnected community working together. These Bloomers want to engage the whole area, from the historic town centre to the modern housing estates on the outskirts, in an effort to bring the community spirit back to their neighbourhood.(n)

programme.title: Scrum V Live (?)
programme.desc: Cardiff v Bridgend (Kick-off 7.10pm). Catrin Heledd is joined by Richie Rees and Matthew Rees to present coverage of the Principality Premiership clash, which takes place at Cardiff Arms Park. When these teams faced each other at Brewery Field in November of last year, Cardiff recorded an emphatic 36-0 victory, despite Cardiff being hampered early in the first half after Sam Pailor was sent to the sin bin for a ruck infringement. The contest proved to be an error-strewn one, but the visitors showed the better quality at key moments, especially in the second half when they scored three tries courtesy of Will Rees-Hole, Tom Daley and Morgan Allen.(n)

programme.title: Australia: Earth's Magical Kingdom (?)
programme.desc: An exploration how native creatures have adapted to survive in the human environment. In Melbourne, tree-dwelling possums have taken to sharing trees in city parks, risking encounters with traffic and cats. In Brisbane's parks, over the past 150 years of so, eastern water dragons have become twice the size of their wild cousins and without trees to climb their limbs are getting longer and claws shorter. Beyond the cities, dingoes eek out an existence in the inhospitable environment of a desert goldmine, while climate change and deforestation is posing a threat to koalas. Narrated by Barry Humphries. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Frankie Boyle's New World Order (?)
programme.desc: New series. The comedian tries to help make sense of bewildering times as he dissects the week's news using stand-up, review, discussion and audience interaction. Featuring contributions from Sara Pascoe, Lucy Prebble and a variety of comic guests.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight (?)
programme.desc: Kirsty Wark provides the latest Brexit analysis, plus an overview of international news stories.(n)

programme.title: Louis Theroux: My Scientology Movie (?)
programme.desc: The reporter investigates the controversial religious organisation, but finds himself denied access to anyone involved. Adopting a different approach, he resorts to recruiting actors to re-enact the personal stories of former members - only to find his project is under surveillance by representatives of the church.(n)

programme.title: Panorama (?)
programme.desc: Bronagh Munro examines the shocking way some academy trusts are running schools, exposing one where the boss employed relatives and whose pupils claim they were taught how to cheat on exams. She also investigates an academy trust that pays its managers big salaries, while unpaid bills and disconnection notices pile up in the classroom.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef (?)
programme.desc: Knockout week comes to a close as the 10 remaining cooks are split into two teams of five. Their challenge is to create a three-course meal in relay, with no communication allowed. They have 20 minutes each, in which time they all have to plan, create and cook a starter featuring scallops, a main course with chicken and a dessert celebrating brown sugar. The winners will automatically become semi-finalists, while the other five have to fight it out again next week to earn their place. Presented by John Torode and Gregg Wallace.(n)

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens (?)
programme.desc: Part two of two. The horticultural enthusiast explores Japan during autumn. He begins as he did in the spring, at one of the `three great gardens of Japan' to learn how they are protected from the coming winter. Monty follows the history of the Japanese garden through the military strongholds of past leaders to the many styles, new and old, of the iconic stroll garden and finds a slice of Victorian England in the heart of Tokyo. He also learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle. He ends his journey by the Sea of Japan at a place that makes art out of its gardens.(n)

programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

Narrated by Lee Ingleby.(n)

programme.title: Flog It (?)
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents as experts Will Axon and Thomas Plant value items at London Zoo in Regent's Park.(n)

programme.title: Weatherman Walking (?)
programme.sub-title: Weatherman Walking: The Welsh Coast: Beaumaris to Red Wharf Bay
programme.desc: Derek Brockway fires the starting cannon at the Beaumaris Regatta on Anglesey, then embarks on a 14-mile walk initially taking him into the town's heavily fortified castle before heading onto the Welsh Coast Path. Derek visits the hamlet of Penmon, before heading to the photogenic Black Nose lighthouse with views over Puffin Island. The walk turns inland for a couple of miles before arriving at a new stretch of path, which has been moved much closer to the headland with fine sea views. Derek's eventual destination is Red Wharf Bay, a wide sandy bay on the east coast of the island.(n)

programme.title: Mastermind (?)
programme.desc: John Humphrys invites four contestants to brave the black chair to answer question on their specialised subjects. of 1970s pop, politician Neville Chamberlain, ancient Greek city Sparta and writer CS Lewis. They are then each afforded two minutes to demonstrate their prowess on general knowledge.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities (?)
programme.desc: The naturalist explores the extremes of birth in the animal kingdom, explaining why the giant panda gives birth to the smallest babies of any existing mammal. He also looks at the kiwi, asking why the bird produces a single egg that is a quarter of its body mass - one of the largest in the world - and almost too big to lay.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu (?)
programme.desc: The two remaining North East chefs must cook their four-course menus again, though it remains to be seen whether they have successfully taken on board feedback from their earlier submissions. The duo need to impress food writer Matthew Fort, restaurateur Oliver Peyton, broadcaster and cook Andi Oliver, as well as guest judge record producer Pete Waterman.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World (?)
programme.desc: Monty Don gets busy on the vegetable plot and takes the next step in planting up his new Paradise Garden. With Mothering Sunday around the corner, he also provides some timely inspiration for planting up a spring pot as a present. Frances Tophill is thrilled to have her own allotment this year, and here shares her plans for the season ahead, making a start on getting it shipshape. The programme also visits the alpine house at RHS Garden Wisley to find out from the experts how they care for some of the smallest and most colourful spring gems.(n)

programme.title: Dad's Army (?)
programme.desc: Captain Mainwaring and his platoon acquire a boat, planning to use it for coastal patrols, but after setting sail they get lost in fog. When the men finally reach dry land, they believe they have crossed the Channel and landed behind enemy lines. Vintage comedy first shown in 1969, starring Arthur Lowe.(n)

The programme features a selection of BBC archive material originally recorded between 1971 and 1986.(n)

programme.title: Good Morning Britain (?)
programme.desc: A lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.(n)

programme.title: Lorraine (?)
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.(n)

programme.title: The Jeremy Kyle Show (?)
programme.sub-title: I Slept With Your Brother but I Hope You're the Dad! DNA Results
programme.desc: The host invites guests to air their differences over family and relationship issues, and provides them with his own brand of no-nonsense advice.(n)

programme.title: This Morning (?)
programme.desc: Eamonn Holmes and Ruth Langsford present a lively mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.(n)

programme.title: Loose Women (?)
programme.desc: Guest panellists engage in topical debate and celebrity interviews from a female perspective.(n)

programme.title: Judge Rinder (?)
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.(n)

programme.title: Tenable (?)
programme.desc: Quizzy McQuizface, a team of pub quizzers from Scotland, answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Warwick Davis hosts.(n)

programme.title: Tipping Point (?)
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.(n)

programme.title: The Chase (?)
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Jude, Kimya, Ricardo and Tom pit their wits against quiz genius the Chaser. Answering general knowledge questions, they each add as much money as they dare to the jackpot - but if anyone is caught they're out for good, leaving fewer players for the final chase.(n)

programme.title: Emmerdale (?)
programme.desc: Laurel is furious with Arthur, Vanessa and Charity make amends, and Billy finds a new lease of life.(n)

programme.title: Coronation Street (?)
programme.desc: Daniel and Sinead bring Bertie home from hospital, Gary's good fortune proves short-lived and Sarah blames Seb for vandalising her partner's van. Meanwhile, Wayne's questions fuel the speculation surrounding Carla, and Robert wastes no time in replacing Ryan at the Bistro.(n)

programme.title: Midsomer Murders (?)
programme.desc: It's the day of the Little Crosby Folk Festival and organiser Toby Winning is found dead, having drowned in a bowl of eggs and live eels. The murder seems to have been inspired by a ballad made famous by the late, lamented star Johnny Carver. Then it comes to light the victim recently announced plans to move the event to a new location, which would have cost local entrepreneur Frank Wainwright dearly. Toby's estranged wife Alice also comes under suspicion, before two further killings take place, echoing more lyrics from the song.(n)

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show (?)
programme.desc: The host is joined this week by Hollywood stars Colin Farrell and Danny DeVito, who will soon be appearing in Tim Burton's new live-action remake of classic Disney animation Dumbo. Also dropping into the studio are double Olympic boxing champion Nicola Adams, and actress and stand-up comedian Lolly Adefope, recently seen in This Time with Alan Patridge and who kicks off a UK tour in Glasgow this week. Scottish singer-songwriter Lewis Capaldi completes the guest list, performing his number one single Someone You Loved.(n)

programme.title: Tenable (?)
programme.desc: A family of five from Bath dubbed the Eager Beaverstocks answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Quiz, hosted by Warwick Davis.(n)

programme.title: Jackpot247 (?)
programme.desc: Viewers are offered the chance to participate in live interactive gaming from the comfort of their sofas, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.(n)

programme.title: All Star Mr & Mrs (?)
programme.desc: Phillip Schofield is joined by Loose Women anchor Kaye Adams and her husband Ian, actress Sue Holderness (Only Fools and Horses) and husband Mark, and former Strictly Come Dancing professional Vincent Simone with his fiancee Susan. The contestants find out how much they really know about their other halves, and the couple who give the most correct answers to a series of questions receive the chance to win £30,000 for their chosen charity.
