When he falls for a single mother, his friends think he is right on course for a lusty liaison, but his new partner is not ready for a physical relationship. Judd Apatow's comedy, starring Steve Carell, Catherine Keener and Paul Rudd.(n)

programme.title: Storm City (?)
programme.desc: Documentary in which Ben Fogle explores the devastating impact of extreme weather, finding out what happens when man is pitted against the power of Mother Nature. He begins with the chaos caused by snow and ice, using real-life studies - such as Montreal being shut down by a fierce ice storm in 1998 - and sharing incredible stories of survival. He then subjects a specially built test house to an avalanche, one of the world's deadliest natural forces.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town (?)
programme.desc: The cameras follow three teams of fishermen participating in Brixham's annual Trawler Race, including a father and son who have been pitted against each other. Landlady Pat Seddon is not looking forward to the raucous celebrations, however, and decides to reminisce about past race days instead. The programme also meets Matt Kimble, a graduate who gave up on his plan to become a PE teacher and decided to follow his ancestors into the fishing trade instead.(n)

programme.title: The British (?)
programme.desc: How Britain changed during the reign of the Tudor and Stuart monarchs. The programme explores the battles that established England as one of the world's leading naval powers and delves into Henry VIII's feud with the Catholic Church, revealing how he tried to silence dissenting voices. Contributors including Helen Mirren and Ben Kingsley also discover how literature from the period sowed the seeds of revolution, and learn why a riot organised from a prison cell laid the foundations for civil war.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Kingdom of Plants (?)
programme.desc: The naturalist and film-maker explores the many varieties of plant life housed at the Royal Botanic Gardens in Kew, west London, and explains what they reveal about the natural world and the development of life on Earth. He begins inside the establishment's Palm House, whose climate has been engineered to simulate conditions found in rainforests, charting the evolution of plants that grow in the world's wettest regions and investigating how flowering plants spread across the globe so rapidly.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Kingdom of Plants (?)
programme.desc: The naturalist explores how the plants at Kew Gardens change through the seasons and demonstrates the surprising properties of several species, including the predatory pond-dwelling bladderwort utricularia and a fungus that appears to be capable of mind control. He also discusses the largest single organism on the planet, visits the world's biggest flower and explains how plants and insects can communicate using scents and music.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Kingdom of Plants (?)
programme.desc: The naturalist concludes his exploration of the Royal Botanic Gardens in Kew, west London, by examining plants that have evolved to minimise their dependence on water, enabling them to survive in the world's driest environments. He witnesses a cactus blooming at midnight, tells the story of the spectacular flowering of the Agave franzosinii, and visits the Millennium Seed Bank, a facility designed to save plants from future extinction.(n)

programme.desc: The body of a politician is found in an empty house, leading the team to investigate whether he was killed as a consequence of his corrupt policies that led to local residents being forced out of their homes. Crime drama, starring David Caruso, Emily Procter and Adam Rodriguez.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Wolfe disturbs a miniature coffin during inquiries at a murder scene, triggering a series of strange events that convinces him the entire investigation is cursed. The approach of Halloween reinforces his belief that mysterious forces are at work - and it is not long before everyone else begins to share the same view. With Jonathan Togo.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A daredevil driver is decapitated while performing a stunt at a street party, bringing the festivities to a premature end. Realising the incident was murder rather than an accident, the team focuses the investigation on a bystander whose expertise with remote-controlled cars makes him a likely suspect. David Caruso, Emily Procter and Adam Rodriguez star.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A DNA assessment of a kidnapping crime scene reveals horrifying results for Natalia, who discovers her sister Anya is one of a number of missing women. Racing to track her down, the team finds a collection of photographs that may hold the key to breaking the case. Starring David Caruso, Eva La Rue and Adam Rodriguez.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A woman is killed shortly after participating in a charity event, and it emerges that she had tried to reveal the involvement of its hosts with terrorists. As the team delves deeper into her mysterious world, a plot is uncovered that could put the entire city in danger. Starring David Caruso.(n)

Jason and Julie are two single, long-time friends who want kids, but are put off by how parenthood has ruined the lives of their best buddies. They concoct a plan whereby they will share child-rearing responsibilities to allow them time to pursue their own love lives. But will the theory work in practice?(n)

What powerful secrets are Morgana and the druid Ruadan searching for among its twisted catacombs? And what dangerous game is Mordred playing? It seems not even Merlin can stop his king from walking into certain danger as the great battle for Albion begins.(n)

programme.title: Buffy the Vampire Slayer

Willow and Tara get back together, but their happy reunion is overshadowed by a sudden and unexpected tragedy.(n)

programme.title: Star Trek: Voyager
programme.desc: The Delta Flyer is captured by a Borg cube. The vessel turns out to be inhabited by a small group of abandoned drones, that nonetheless tries to assimilate the crew. programme.desc: Feature-length first episode of Joss Whedon's sci-fi drama. Veteran soldier Mal Reynolds becomes the captain of a spaceship used for smuggling after a civil war in which he was on the losing side. While ferrying his latest illicit cargo under the noses of the government, he takes on three passengers to provide respectable cover - but all of them seem to have secrets to hide. Starring Nathan Fillion.(n)

programme.title: Firefly
programme.desc: The crew accept a job from a sadistic gangster to steal cargo from a moving train. While the plan goes off without a hitch, they discover they have taken urgently needed medical supplies. Mal's conscience is pricked by the plight of the locals, but doing the right thing means incurring the wrath of their employer, who does not take kindly to failure.(n)

programme.title: Firefly
programme.desc: The crew encounter a derelict ship and go in search of salvage, only to find the craft had been attacked by the cannibalistic Reavers, leaving only one traumatised survivor. As they contend with booby traps left by the savage marauders, they are boarded by the Alliance and arrested for looting - while the refugee they rescued has been dangerously warped by the horrors he has witnessed.(n)

programme.title: Firefly
programme.desc: Mal gets a tip-off from Badger regarding a wealthy businessman looking to smuggle some cargo. He and Kaylee go to a high society party in the hope of sealing the deal, where Mal comes to blows with one of Inara's clients and ends up challenged to a duel. As Mal gets to grips with sword fighting, Badger takes over the ship to stop the crew interfering.(n)

programme.title: Firefly
programme.desc: When the crew deliver cargo to a frontier world, Simon and River are taken hostage by settlers. When Book is injured in a gunfight with bandits, Mal is forced to call off the search for his missing crewmembers and seek the aid of the Alliance to save the preacher's life. Simon learns his captors are not as malicious as they appeared and are in urgent need of his help. Featuring a young Zac Efron.(n)

programme.title: Firefly
programme.desc: The crew drive off bandits plaguing a frontier settlement, but while celebrating their victory, Mal unwittingly performs a traditional marriage ceremony with a local woman. She stows away aboard the ship and seems eager to please her husband, leaving Jayne consumed with envy. However, the supposedly innocent woman secretly has more sinister plans in mind for the ship and its unsuspecting crew. Christina Hendricks (Mad Men) guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Firefly
programme.desc: Jayne is anxious to keep a low profile when the crew visits a planet where he is still wanted for a robbery he committed years ago. This proves difficult when it turns out the downtrodden populace consider him a Robin Hood-style folk hero. As Mal tries to find a way to turn Jayne's fame to his advantage, a vengeful old partner in crime comes looking for the accidental hero.(n)

programme.desc: Disaster movie from Independence Day director Roland Emmerich, starring Dennis Quaid and Jake Gyllenhaal. When climatologist Jack Hall tries to warn Washington that the planet is facing an imminent, catastrophic climate shift, government officials fail to take him seriously. But, when the Earth abruptly plunges into a new ice age, it soon becomes clear that the human race is facing extinction.(n)

While patrolling off the Cuban coast, an American nuclear submarine encounters a mysterious unseen force travelling at great speed. In the ensuing confusion, the vessel sinks 2,000 feet on to the ledge of an abyss. The crew's only hope of survival is a team of underwater drillers led by a tough foreman.(n)

programme.title: TOTP2

programme.title: Biggest Band Break-Ups and Make-Ups
programme.desc: Mark Radcliffe looks at the highs and lows of life in a band. He focuses on the creative tension that produces great material, as well as the pressures that comes with success and fame that can pull groups apart. The presenter looks at the most common reasons for splitting up, alongside the secrets of those that manage to stay together. (BBC Four/radiotimes.com)(n)

programme.title: Country & Beyond with the Shires
programme.desc: Country duo Ben Earle and Crissie Rhodes reveal the songs that shaped their musical journey. They begin with Dolly Parton's iconic track Jolene. Following that comes Patsy Cline, as Crissie recalls singing along to Crazy with her grandmother. Ben then picks country-pop crossover Shania Twain, whose That Don't Impress Me Much certainly made its mark on him. He also plumps for Glen Campbell's legendary Wichita Lineman. The pair also cite critically acclaimed duo the Civil Wars and their spine-tingling live appearance on Later - with Jools Holland. (BBC Four/radiotimes.com)(n)

programme.title: British Sitcom: 60 Years of Laughing at Ourselves

Narrated by Rebecca Front, and featuring contributions from writers and actors including Steve Coogan, Richard Curtis, James Corden, Graham Linehan, Dick Clement and Ian La Frenais. (BBC Four/radiotimes.com)(n)

(BBC Four/radiotimes.com)(n)

programme.title: Fleetwood Mac: A Musical History
programme.desc: Fleetwood Mac are the great survivors of British and American rock music. For more than 50 years they've overcome break-ups and breakdowns to become one of the most successful bands of all time, selling over 100 million records worldwide, with their 1977 smash Rumours accounting for nearly half of those sales. Here, fan Edith Bowman provides a narrative overview, alongside fellow celebrity admirers who all pay tribute to the band. Contributors include KT Tunstall, Travis' frontman Fran Healy, Toyah Willcox, Sian Pattenden and Emma Dabiri. Last in the series. (BBC Four/radiotimes.com)(n)

programme.title: The Beatles: Made on Merseyside
programme.desc: Few dispute that the Beatles defined 1960s music and popular culture like no other band, but how John, Paul, George and Ringo made the journey from Merseyside teenagers to international pop stars is less known. Director Alan Byron's documentary recounts the rise of the band as American rock 'n' roll and rhythm and blues dragged post-war Liverpool into one of the most vibrant music cities ever with the Mersey Beat sound. (BBC Four/radiotimes.com)(n)

programme.title: Sgt Pepper's Musical Revolution - with Howard Goodall
programme.desc: The composer explores why the Beatles' 50-year-old album is still revered as an innovative, revolutionary and influential release. With the help of out-takes, studio conversations between the band and never-heard-before outside of Abbey Road, Howard gets `under the bonnet' of the album, taking the music apart and reassembling it to reveal how it works. Producer George Martin and his team constructed the album sound by sound, layer by layer - a formula that became the norm for just about every rock act who followed. (BBC Four/radiotimes.com)(n)

programme.title: Classic Albums: Paul Simon - Graceland
programme.desc: WARNING : show ends after 00:00!! The writing and recording of Paul Simon's Graceland, featuring tracks such as Diamonds on the Sole of Her Shoes. Since its 1986 release this album, with its blend of Western sounds and African rhythms, has changed the course of rock music. Contributors include composer Philip Glass. (BBC Four/radiotimes.com)(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1987
programme.desc: Janice Long and Simon Mayo introduces performances by Boy George, Atlantic Starr, Judy Boucher, Los Lobos, Errol Brown, Samantha Fox, Marillion, Beastie Boys, Luther Vandross, Shakin' Stevens, Madonna and Boogie Box High, in an edition first aired on July 23. (BBC Four/radiotimes.com)(n)

programme.title: Primal Scream: The Lost Memphis Tapes
programme.desc: The discovery of the band's missing tracks, laid down in Memphis' Ardent Studios in 1993, but subsequently mislaid. The band later re-recorded the songs with a new producer, and they were incorporated into their 1994 album Give Out But Don't Give Up, meaning the originals were left unreleased. With previously unreleased footage of behind-the-scenes studio sessions, this is the story of how the original mix tapes of the album were rediscovered in a basement by Andrew Innes, Primal Scream's rhythm guitarist. (BBC Four/radiotimes.com)(n)

programme.title: Fleetwood Mac: A Musical History
programme.desc: Fleetwood Mac are the great survivors of British and American rock music. For more than 50 years they've overcome break-ups and breakdowns to become one of the most successful bands of all time, selling over 100 million records worldwide, with their 1977 smash Rumours accounting for nearly half of those sales. programme.title: Jacqueline du Pre: A Gift Beyond Words
programme.desc: Tribute to the cellist, originally shown in October 2017, marking the 30th anniversary of her death. Du Pre was one of Britain's most acclaimed performing musicians, but her career was cut short by a diagnosis of multiple sclerosis when she was 28, leading to her death just 14 years later. The programme features footage from five films made during her lifetime. (BBC Four/radiotimes.com)(n)

He also hears how caucasian shepherd dog Georgie is struggling to find a home due to her unusual appearance - her ears have been docked, giving her a scary look. Paul thinks a few website pictures might do the trick and calls on leading fashion photographer Rankin to help out. Finally, an injured Jack Russell is found by a council warden and rushed straight into surgery. Even if the operation is a success, can the dog hope to get over such a nasty experience?(n)

programme.title: Doc Martin (?)

Meanwhile, Margaret reveals the real reason she has come to Portwenn, and disaster strikes at Bert and Jennifer's engagement party when Caroline receives an electric shock.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of Growing Old (?)
programme.desc: Documentary unravelling the secrets of ageing, including the changing attitudes to `growing old', with examples of people who are defying preconceptions of what it means to be `old'. Scientists estimate that one in five people will live to be 100, with at least one baby born this year likely to reach the age of 150. The programme meets 83-year-old Dilys Price, who is now the world's oldest skydiver after refusing to give up, 96-year-old Charles Eugster, who has the body of a man 30 years younger, and 82-year-old Alan Wrigley, who is one of the most valuable employees at B&Q in Rochdale.(n)

programme.title: Vera (?)
programme.desc: Respected surgeon Dan Marsden is shot dead days before his retirement and his teenage daughters Mira and Karen are abducted. Joined by a new addition to the ranks, Vera investigates a mysterious parcel and a connection to the Iraq War as she races against time to catch the killer and save the girls. However, the case soon takes a violent and unexpected turn, striking at the heart of the team. Guest starring Saskia Reeves (Luther) and Dean Andrews (Ashes to Ashes), with Brenda Blethyn, David Leon and Gareth Farr.(n)

programme.desc: Jack grows suspicious of Vera `working late'. Derek starts looking for a job, Steve is scared that he's going to Borstal, while Sally finds it hard looking after all the children.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat (?)
programme.desc: A gang of youths push Peggy down a hole while she's poaching. Lord Ashfordly alerts Miller, who gives chase - but lands himself in trouble when he knocks down an elderly pedestrian. However, the incident gives Peggy a new money-making idea - she'll sue for the `injury' she sustained in the fall. Meanwhile, Gina is attracted to her handsome college tutor. Tim Brooke-Taylor and Murray Head guest star.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote (?)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple (?)
programme.desc: Ever since a beautiful American woman arrived in the peaceful village of Wychwood-under-Ashe, people have begun to die in a series of apparent accidents. Nobody suspects a killer is at work but, as the body count rises, Miss Marple digs a little deeper with the help of a former policeman - and they gradually unearth a secret that will rock the village to its core. Murder mystery, starring Julia McKenzie, Benedict Cumberbatch, David Haig, Sylvia Syms, Margo Stilley and Hugo Speer.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat (?)
programme.desc: A gang of elderly villains spot a chance for one last, glorious crime spree when the villagers leave Aidensfield en masse to support Rob in a charity football match. Rural police drama, starring Sophie Ward, Jonathan Kerrigan, Gwen Taylor and David Lonsdale.(n)

programme.title: Coronation Street (?)

programme.title: Coronation Street (?)
programme.desc: Kevin realises he will lose his job if he goes to the police, while Derek plans to claim unfair dismissal and Alma cannot understand Mike's motives in giving her the lease.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple (?)
programme.desc: As the sole witness to a dying man's last words, Bobby Attfield is determined to solve the riddle they present, and forms an unlikely alliance with socialite Frankie Derwent and visiting family friend Miss Marple to help him on his quest. A trail of clues leads them to Castle Savage, where they uncover a hotbed of stifled emotion, treachery and deceit among its strange inhabitants. Murder mystery, starring Julia McKenzie, with a supporting cast that includes Sean Biggerstaff, Samantha Bond, Richard Briers, Rafe Spall, Warren Clarke, Mark Williams, Georgia Moffett, Helen Lederer and Rik Mayall.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote (?)
programme.desc: Jessica discovers her former boss, who was previously jailed for murder, is in the dock again, accused of stabbing a man to death. His passionate pleas of innocence convince her he could be telling the truth, so she resolves to get to the bottom of the matter. Guest starring Spinal Tap's Michael McKean.(n)

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs (?)
programme.desc: Paul meets Bert, a bouncy Great Dane puppy who is suffering growing pains, and needs surgery to prevent his front legs developing in an abnormal fashion. He also hears how caucasian shepherd dog Georgie is struggling to find a home due to her unusual appearance - her ears have been docked, giving her a scary look. Paul thinks a few website pictures might do the trick and calls on leading fashion photographer Rankin to help out. Finally, an injured Jack Russell is found by a council warden and rushed straight into surgery. Even if the operation is a success, can the dog hope to get over such a nasty experience?(n)

programme.title: Doc Martin (?)
programme.desc: The doctor becomes convinced something is wrong with him following a conversation with his mother, and Louisa's attempts at getting him to open up about the loss of his father prove futile. Mrs Tishell goes to the surgery for advice regarding a pain in her jaw, only to find herself falling in love with Martin all over again. Elsewhere, Al receives a visit from two military policemen who are trying to track down Mike Pruddy.(n)

programme.title: Doc Martin (?)
programme.desc: Louisa decides to leave for Spain with baby James and says an awkward goodbye to Martin, but when he finds the scan of her brain, he spots a malformation and realises she could suffer a haemorrhage if she gets on the plane. Will the doctor make it to the airport in time? Meanwhile, Margaret reveals the real reason she has come to Portwenn, and disaster strikes at Bert and Jennifer's engagement party when Caroline receives an electric shock.(n)

programme.title: Lewis (?)
programme.desc: A serial killer begins targeting members of a religious group that claims to provide guidance for lost souls. As the investigation proceeds, it becomes clear that Hathaway, who once trained for the priesthood, knows more about the case than he is willing to reveal - causing Lewis to consider him as a suspect. Guest starring Ian McNeice and Rachael Stirling alongside Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot (?)
programme.desc: The sleuth heads to Lake Windermere for a holiday with faithful assistant Hastings, only to find his crime-solving skills are once again needed to investigate a murder. The only witness to the crime is a dog, leaving Poirot with a difficult task to find the killer. David Suchet stars, with Kate Buffery, Patrick Ryecart and Julia St John.(n)

programme.title: Liverpool 1 (?)
programme.desc: Cally thinks his future with the squad is on the line, when a former friend and known criminal calls in a favour. Drama about vice squad officers, starring Samantha Womack. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of Growing Old (?)
programme.desc: Documentary unravelling the secrets of ageing, including the changing attitudes to `growing old', with examples of people who are defying preconceptions of what it means to be `old'. Scientists estimate that one in five people will live to be 100, with at least one baby born this year likely to reach the age of 150. The programme meets 83-year-old Dilys Price, who is now the world's oldest skydiver after refusing to give up, 96-year-old Charles Eugster, who has the body of a man 30 years younger, and 82-year-old Alan Wrigley, who is one of the most valuable employees at B&Q in Rochdale.(n)

programme.title: Road to Avonlea (?)
programme.desc: The King family plan a surprise birthday party for Hetty while she is visiting her publisher - but she returns bearing bad news, and Muriel's return only make things worse.(n)

programme.title: Road to Avonlea (?)
programme.desc: Jasper gets a new job, but finds it leaves him no time to work on his inventions. When Hetty buys a lobster cannery, he sees a chance to create machines for her.(n)

programme.title: A Touch of Frost (?)
programme.desc: Jack tackles what promises to be the most sensitive and unenviable investigation of his entire career - deciding whether a man with Down's syndrome is capable of committing murder. David Jason stars as the caustic copper, with Bruce Alexander and Matthew Marsh.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple (?)
programme.desc: Feature-length drama. While holidaying at the plush Bertram's Hotel in London, Miss Marple is presented with a fresh challenge to her deductive powers when the reading of a will leads to a double murder. Geraldine McEwan stars as the elderly spinster with a nose for a mystery, with guest appearances by Peter Davison, Mica Paris and Francesca Annis.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple (?)
programme.desc: When Jacko Argyle is executed for the murder of his stepmother, his family attempt to put the tragedy behind them, until a stranger provides an alibi that proves Jacko's innocence. Suspicion falls on every member of the household when it transpires that they all are much happier since the death of the matriarch. Miss Marple is conveniently on hand to solve the mystery. Geraldine McEwan stars, with Juliet Stevenson, Denis Lawson and Alison Steadman.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple (?)
programme.desc: When a business magnate, his wife and their maid are murdered, Miss Marple (Julia McKenzie) is prompted by the circumstances surrounding the incidents to recall the nursery rhyme Sing a Song of Sixpence. She discovers the victims were part of a family tainted by secrets, and as she ponders the significance of the tune, a past scandal reveals itself. Murder mystery, featuring Wendy Richard as feisty cook Mrs Crump, in her final dramatic role. Other guest stars include Prunella Scales, Matthew Macfadyen, Ralf Little, Rupert Graves and Helen Baxendale.(n)

programme.title: Vera (?)
programme.desc: The detectives investigate two murders in which the victims have been placed in water and surrounded by flowers. Vera and sidekick Joe believe the culprit may be linked to a group of bird-watching friends, but despite their increasingly tangled and dysfunctional relationships, the twitchers seem determined to protect one another. Drama adapted from Ann Cleeves' novel Hidden Depths, starring Brenda Blethyn, David Leon, Gina McKee, Wunmi Mosaku, Paul Ritter and Neil Armstrong.(n)

programme.title: Vera (?)
programme.desc: The detective investigates when a seemingly beloved resident of a coastal community is fatally driven off the road, and digs up the victim's past in the hope of unmasking the killer. Crime drama based on Ann Cleeves' series of novels, starring Brenda Blethyn.(n)

programme.title: Bear's Mission (?)
programme.desc: Adventurer Bear Grylls teaches the accomplished boxer some alternative survival skills. Next, Bear surprises AJ with a tricky descent - a major challenge for anyone nervous of heights - with a `death drop' on all sides. programme.desc: An intruder begins breaking into people's homes and destroying their plaster statuettes of Napoleon, but leaving more valuable items untouched. Holmes resolves to find out why, eventually uncovering a twisted tale of theft and murder. Jeremy Brett stars as the master detective.(n)

programme.desc: The mystery surrounding a legendary racehorse's disappearance is solved with the help of one of the most famous clues in the Holmes canon - `the curious incident of the dog in the night-time'. Victorian detective drama, starring Jeremy Brett and Edward Hardwicke.(n)

programme.title: Kojak (?)
programme.desc: Theo investigates how his own camera came to be among a murdered man's possessions and gradually realises his nephew holds the key to the mystery. Telly Savalas, Neville Brand and Michael Mullins star.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: A Deadly State of Mind (?)
programme.desc: A philandering psychiatrist, who involved his mistress in a series of hypnosis experiments, kills her husband in the heat of the moment when the pair are caught out. He persuades his distraught lover to make up a story involving two burglars, but Lt Columbo realises she is lying and goes in search of the truth. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, George Hamilton and Lesley Warren.(n)

programme.title: ITV Racing Live (?)
programme.desc: Francesca Cumani presents coverage of the opening day of the flat season at Doncaster, including the Unibet Lincoln (Heritage Handicap), which follows races at 1.50, 2.25 and 3.00. Plus, races at 2.05. 2.40 and 3.15 from Kempton Park. With analysis from Jason Weaver and Kevin Blake, reports by Oli Bell, Matt Chapman and Sally Ann Grassick, and commentary from Richard Hoiles.(n)

programme.desc: James Bond is sent to steal a top-secret Soviet decoding machine and ends up helping its operator defect to the West. programme.title: Britain's Biggest Primary School (?)
programme.desc: It's nearly the end of term at Gascoigne Primary School in Barking, east London, and Year 6 head Sarah Murphy must get sufficient children to meet basic SATs requirements before they leave, or the school risks a fresh Ofsted inspection. Ben is struggling to achieve the minimum Level 4, while Iliana is hoping to attain top marks and a place at grammar school. Meanwhile, Brandon, Zain and Tahha's battle for space to play football in the overcrowded playground leads to an accusation of racism.(n)

programme.title: Spotlight London (?)
programme.desc: Interviews about arts and events showcasing London's vibrant culture scene.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun (?)
programme.desc: A property expert offers advice to British householders aiming to buy a home abroad.(n)

programme.title: Frequencies (?)
programme.desc: Scientists discover frequencies emitted by the human brain, that can be used to predetermine every aspect of their life. A student falls in love with a woman whose frequencies are different to his, meaning they should be incompatible - but he is determined to prove science wrong. Romantic sci-fi drama, starring Daniel Fraser and Eleanor Wyld.(n)

programme.title: London Live Sessions (?)
programme.desc: Intimate performances by London's up-and-coming bands, featuring You Me at Six.(n)

programme.title: Age of Kill (?)
programme.desc: A professional sniper is blackmailed into taking a new mission, which involves shooting six people in six hours. If he misses, reports the plot or is caught by the authorities, the terrorist behind the scheme promises to raise the death toll higher. Action thriller, starring Martin Kemp, Patrick Bergin and Bruce Payne.(n)

programme.title: Purely Belter (?)
programme.desc: Two obsessive Newcastle United fans resolve to earn the £2,000 they need to get a season ticket apiece for their beloved Magpies - but personal problems dog their every attempt to raise the cash, meaning they may miss out on another season of soccer action. Comedy drama, starring Chris Beattie, Greg McLane, Tim Healy and Jody Baldwin.(n)

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Collar of Duty (?)
programme.desc: A border collie/husky mix named Kallie aids a teenage boy struggling with deep depression and is the muse for his career aspirations.(n)

programme.title: Collar of Duty (?)
programme.desc: A motor accident left Adam paralysed and he did not realise there was a void in his life until he got Gus, a chocolate Labrador who unintentionally became his service dog.(n)

programme.title: Nigel Marven's Rhino Adventure (?)
programme.desc: The naturalist sets out to film the five remaining species of rhino, beginning with the white variety in Africa, where many of the 12,000 animals are bought by farmers at auction as tourist attractions. Nigel also visits Umfolozi National Park in South Africa, a sanctuary for black rhinos, and turns his attention to the lesser-known Indian breed.(n)

programme.title: Wild Africa (?)
programme.desc: The wildlife of Africa's green belt, an area spanning 5,500km from Uganda in the east to Sierra Leone in the west, which is hotter, brighter and wetter than anywhere else on the continent, allowing plants to flourish. People and animals have learned to exploit this abundance - colobus monkeys have developed specialised bacteria-filled stomachs to neutralise the toxins found in their leafy diet, while the Bakaya and Fang tribes use plant poisons to stun their quarry when hunting.(n)

programme.title: Frozen Planet (?)
programme.sub-title: To the Ends of the Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough travels to the Arctic and Antarctic to explore the wildernesses at Earth's poles, investigating the wildlife and geographical features found there. He begins by travelling to the North Pole, where two polar bears reveal a surprisingly tender side to their characters, before heading to the South Pole - 100 years after Roald Amundsen and Robert Falcon Scott first reached it.(n)

The location proves challenging to explore due to high temperatures and humidity approaching 100 per cent, meaning the team must wear refrigerated suits and respirators.(n)

programme.title: Radioactive Wolves (?)
programme.desc: Film-makers and scientists follow packs of wolves living in Chernobyl's `dead zone' to discover what happens to wildlife after a nuclear accident.(n)

programme.title: Gorilla Family and Me (?)
programme.desc: Part two of two. Gordon Buchanan returns to the Democratic Republic of Congo in the hope of finding the gorilla family again, and discovering the outcome of silverback Chimanuka's confrontation with a rival. He soon finds the apes, but discovers their lives are now under threat from poachers, and works with the local rangers to prevent them coming to harm.(n)

programme.title: John Bishop's Australia (?)
programme.desc: In 1992, the 25-year-old John Bishop rode a bicycle through Australia and back to Liverpool. But having spent all day on the road, he always felt he missed out on so much of the country he rode through. Now he returns to retrace his journey Down Under, using his original diary as a guidebook, meeting a range of extraordinary characters and experiencing true natural wonders. The comic begins by talking about his life back in the UK 22 years ago, and why he decided to set off on the journey in the first place, before he travels to Sydney and sets off up the east coast.(n)

programme.title: John Bishop's Australia (?)
programme.desc: John Bishop continues his Aussie cycling trek, taking plenty of breaks along the way to sample the various delights the country has to offer. In the beach town of Byron Bay, New South Wales, he gets shown up by a gang of super-fit local lads and tries his hand at surfing, and then encounters giant saltwater crocodiles as he heads further north toward Queensland. In Rockhampton, the comedian goes cattle herding on horseback with the biggest beef baron in Australia, and it's no laughing matter when he gets a little too close to the action at a rodeo.(n)

programme.title: John Bishop's Australia (?)
programme.desc: The comic pedals his way deep into tropical Australia, where he takes on an exhausting military test and rides a different type of bike to the one he's become used to as he goes motorcycling with Vietnam veterans. He also gets dirty down under while working on a banana farm, before the trip concludes with a breathtaking trip to the Great Barrier Reef, the Daintree rainforest and a surprising personal twist.(n)

programme.title: Ten Deadliest Snakes with Nigel Marven (?)
programme.desc: The adventurous naturalist and snake lover comes face-to-face with some of the most lethal snakes in Malaysia.(n)

programme.desc: The history of tanks, from the First World War to the most sophisticated modern armoured vehicles.(n)

programme.title: Time Team (?)
programme.sub-title: Lincoln's Inn, London: Called to the Bar
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the crew look for the remains of a 13th-century palace in Lincoln's Inn, London, a building that became the birthplace of the British legal system and was home to Henry III's Lord Chancellor. They also investigate Lincoln's Inn Fields, the biggest public square in central London. Over the course of three days, both sites produce glimpses of some of the defining events that have shaped the city's history.(n)

programme.title: Time Team (?)
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and a team of specialist historians travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to investigate a wide range of archaeological sites, and carry out a dig over a period of several days in the hope of unearthing items of cultural importance.(n)

programme.title: Murder Maps (?)
programme.desc: The case of Dr Crippen, who murdered his wife and buried her in the basement before fleeing to Canada.(n)

programme.desc: The story of an RAF pilot with incredible night vision, which supposedly came from eating carrots. Plus, rebels in the Philippines who believed they were fighting a vampire.(n)

programme.title: Planet Earth (?)
programme.desc: The nature series looks at animals that live on some of the world's highest mountains. Cameras show gelada baboons screaming to frighten off predators in Ethiopia, demoiselle cranes struggling to migrate over the Himalayas, snow leopards hunting on the peaks of Pakistan and a wild giant panda nursing a baby in a hillside cave. Presented by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: Wild Africa (?)
programme.desc: Documentary focusing the mountains of Africa, home to many rarely seen species. From the snow-covered peaks of Kilimanjaro to the Ethiopian Highlands where temperatures fall as low as -20C, wildlife continues to thrive, including the rat-catching wolves which revel in their rodent-infested territory and bone-smashing vultures with a taste for marrow. Unique habits and survival instincts are all on display as the unpredictability and numerous threats to mountain life are revealed.(n)

programme.title: Nazi Hunters (?)
programme.desc: The story of German architect Albert Speer, one of the only war criminals to accept his guilt during the Nuremberg trials, although there were doubts about the scale of his remorse.(n)

programme.title: Impossible Railways (?)
programme.desc: A look at the planet's most incredible metropolitan railways, and how they help people solve distinctly urban problems. Including a project to upgrade New York's transit system.(n)

programme.title: Trains That Changed the World (?)
programme.desc: The stories behind the most important trains in history and their impact on the world, beginning with a look at the first locomotives during the Industrial Revolution.(n)

programme.title: Impossible Railways (?)
programme.desc: Documentary exploring unusual rail networks from around the world, beginning with a look at trains in cities, including an inverted monorail in Wuppertal, Germany. With contributions from Susana Esteves da Fonseca.(n)

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two (?)
programme.desc: How Field Marshall Erich von Manstein's escape from the Red Army influenced Nato's defence plans.(n)

programme.title: Raiders of the Lost Art (?)
programme.desc: Works by Leonardo da Vinci that have been lost or stolen, including when the Mona Lisa was taken from the Louvre in Paris in 1911 - and Pablo Picasso was accused of the crime.(n)

programme.title: China's Megatomb: Secrets of the Terracotta Army (?)
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the tomb of China's first Emperor and its army of Terracotta Warriors, revealing the macabre secrets that have challenged accepted historical records.(n)

programme.title: Prince John: The Windsors' Tragic Secret (?)
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the story of King George V's youngest child, unravelling some of the mysteries and misconceptions surrounding him. Born in 1904, Prince John was diagnosed as epileptic and died at an early age - had he lived, he would have become the present Queen's uncle. Here, new research and photographic evidence are combined to build up a picture of his life.(n)

programme.title: Time Team (?)
programme.sub-title: Stonton Wyville, Leicestershire: Saxons on the Edge
programme.desc: An unassuming field near Stonton Wyville, Leicestershire, provides the team with a prize that has eluded them for 15 years. In a first for the programme, Tony Robinson and the team finally uncover the rarest of archaeological finds - an Anglo Saxon settlement and, in an attempt to discover the true origin of Britain's most famous Wessex Man, Phil Harding undergoes a DNA test to establish where his ancestors came from.(n)

programme.title: Time Team (?)
programme.sub-title: Hunstrete, Somerset: Keeping Up with the Georgians
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team descend on a field outside Bath to search for the remains of the Georgian house built 200 years previously by local MP Francis Popham. A set of stone arches is all that remains of the property, but two oil paintings suggest it was once one of the grandest homes in Britain - although the results of the dig tell a very different story.(n)

programme.title: Time Team (?)
programme.sub-title: Coberley, Gloucestershire: Mysteries of the Mosaic
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team head to a Cotswolds field, where they suspect the great and the good of Roman Britain once built their homes. However, an extensive dig reveals that the site was once a hub of worship for Bacchus, the pagan god of wine and entertainment, and its destruction was a result of iconoclasm practised by early Roman Christians.(n)

programme.title: Time Team (?)
programme.sub-title: Padstow, Cornwall: From Constantinople to Cornwall
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team head to Padstow, Cornwall, to investigate why 1,500-year-old pottery and metalwork originating in North Africa and Turkey have been discovered by locals. The geophysics results suggest the field in which they were found may have contained an Iron Age village, while the archaeologists suspect the nearby sandy cove may have been a port dealing with traders from throughout the Mediterranean.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities (?)
programme.desc: David Attenborough takes a look at animals that rely on other species, from cuckoos planting their eggs in other birds' nests to the death's-head hawkmoth stealing honey.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities (?)
programme.desc: David Attenborough takes a look at gorillas and vampire bats, two species that have unfairly gained unpleasant reputation within the animal kingdom.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities (?)
programme.desc: The veteran naturalist reflects on the remarkable abilities that some plants and animals possess, such as the electric eel that helped inspire the battery and flowers that `talk' to bees using electrical signals.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities (?)
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the emperor penguin and the wood frog, both of which survive in conditions so cold they seem to defy the laws of nature. The emperor is the only penguin able to breed on Antarctic sea ice during winter, while the wood frog can survive up to 65 per cent of its body mass freezing during its hibernation.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities (?)
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines creatures that spin and weave, contemplating the history of silk production and its romantic origins in China.(n)

programme.desc: David Attenborough reveals why male seahorses give birth, and looks at how hyena packs are dominated by the female members.(n)

programme.title: Impossible Railways (?)
programme.desc: The daring engineering that has overcome some of the greatest mountain ranges to create innovative railways, including a tunnel in the Swiss Alps and a zig-zag railway in Ecuador.(n)

programme.title: Impossible Railways (?)
programme.desc: How some of our greatest railways have challenged engineering's finest minds in their efforts to conquer the planet's waterways, including a tunnel beneath the English Channel.(n)

programme.title: Impossible Engineering (?)
programme.desc: A fully relocatable polar research station in Antarctica, which was inspired by a revolutionary icebreaking ship and ingenious designs for pre-fabricated buildings.(n)

programme.title: Impossible Engineering (?)
programme.desc: The construction and maintenance of the International Space Station, revealing the influence of an unconventional aircraft designer and a 19th-century rebreather.(n)

programme.title: Private Lives (?)
programme.desc: Dr Tracy Borman, Chief Curator at Historic Royal Palaces, travels to Paris to reveal Napoleon's relationships, from nervous first encounters with a prostitute to his all-consuming love for Josephine, his Empress consort. She visits the statesman and military leader's former home Malmaison and the Palace of Fontainebleau to view his throne room and reveals the secrets to his extraordinary success - and calamitous downfall.(n)
